text: hi guys it's soup time again so I love
soup especially as we're going into
these colder months and I've seen a lot
of comments from you guys that you
wanted to see more soup recipes so today
I'm sharing with you my soup recipe
which is one of my favorites not quite a
traditional Asian recipe but I thought I
would share it with you anyways because
it's a very clean tasting healthy soup
that uses ginger and garlic for flavors
now for the prep time this soup is going
to take an hour and 15 minutes to make
but I don't want you guys to be
intimidated because the first 15 minutes
is really just prepping and cutting the
veggies and the next hour is simmering
the soup Plus as an added bonus you'll
have tons of leftovers for the next day
or two so here's what we need to get
started for the ingredients you should
start by prepping your veggies
we'll need 1 medium onion or half a
large onion a few stalks of celery and
carrots in roughly equal amounts chop up
your veggies then set those aside on a
plate we will also need 2 cloves of
garlic peeled 1 cube of vegetable
bullion 1 pound of lean ground turkey
and 1 small piece of ginger peeled and
sliced and finally 1 cup of Bob's Red
Mill veggie soup mix which is just a
blend of split peas barley lentils and
vegetable pasta now I like using this
veggie soup mix because even though it
doesn't have any spices in there it has
all the beans that we need and it saves
me from having to buy individual bags of
beans and mix them myself
so it's just another kitchen shortcut
now let's cook preheat a large stock pot
and add your ground turkey don't worry
about adding oil because after it starts
cooking it won't stick to your pan stir
and break up the pieces of Turkey as you
go
and at this time add a bit of salt and
pepper to season the meat once the
ground turkey is cooked go ahead to add
your bean mix bullion and chopped
veggies then add filtered water to your
soup it doesn't need to be exact but I
usually fill up my stockpot roughly
halfway once the soup has come to a boil
give it one last stir turn the heat on
low cover and let it simmer for one hour
after one hour remove the ginger and
garlic pieces salt and pepper to taste
as needed and finally serve the soup pot
and for an extra treat I like to serve
mine with warm garlic bread
so that's how easy it is to make my
turkey veggie ginger soup now if you
want to substitute the turkey for
chicken or even leave it out to make it
a vegan soup you can and what I like to
do the next day is whenever you're
heating this soup
I sometimes like to add a little bit of
tofu maybe some broccoli or kale even
avocado pretty much whatever is in your
fridge will likely work
I mean j'l I hope you enjoyed this video
don't forget to Like and subscribe for
more videos and I will see you guys soon
stay warm bye
you
